infotexts.loadingscreentip: ‖color:gui.blue‖More Level Content Tip: ‖end‖Distress beacons won't last forever, they will disapear from the map after some time.
‖color:gui.blue‖More Level Content Tip: ‖end‖Jump starters can be used to restart shuttles that have run out of power.
‖color:gui.blue‖More Level Content Tip: ‖end‖If you take your time on a distress mission, whoever activated it might be dead by the time you show up.
‖color:gui.blue‖More Level Content Tip: ‖end‖If you have Dynamic Europa installed, high reputation with the Bandit faction will turn pirate bases passive.
‖color:gui.blue‖More Level Content Tip: ‖end‖There have been reports of pirate bases using sonar jammers to mask their presence.
‖color:gui.blue‖More Level Content Tip: ‖end‖Following stange sonar pings may lead to automatic traders, waystations or other structures. Who knows what you could find!

‖color:gui.blue‖More Level Content Tip: ‖end‖When responding to a distress beacon, submariners may find whoever activated it dead on arrival. For submariners looking for a reward, all is not lost as if they had a sub it can be salvaged.
‖color:gui.blue‖More Level Content Tip: ‖end‖Visiting a waystation will often reveal another location on the map.
infotexts.dgs.obj.exploreship: Explore at least 50% of the ship.
infotexts.dgs.obj.optionalsalvage: (OPTIONAL) Salvage the ghostship by bringing it to the end of the level.
infotexts.dgs.inrageforsalvage: The drifting ghostship is in range for salvage.
